meanings.definition: The process of reducing the skill level required for a particular job or task.
meanings.sent1: Deskilling can lead to more people being able to do the job.
meanings.sent2: The deskilling of certain tasks has made them more accessible to a wider range of workers.
meanings.sent3: When the robot started doing the work, it was a case of deskilling for the employees.
meanings.sent4: The deskilling of the assembly line turned skilled craftsmen into mere button pushers.
meanings.sent5: The deskilling of the job made it seem like anyone could do it.

meanings.definition: The act of making a job or task simpler and less specialized.
meanings.sent1: Deskilling can sometimes result in faster completion of tasks.
meanings.sent2: The deskilling of the process allowed for more employees to be trained quickly.
meanings.sent3: The deskilling of the task made it feel like anyone could be an expert.
meanings.sent4: The deskilling of the job turned it into a mindless routine.
meanings.sent5: The deskilling of the role removed the need for extensive training.
